explanations.a: Differential pulse voltammetry is a modern, more sensitive technique but not the basis of classical polarography.
explanations.b: Cyclic voltammetry is a different voltammetric method, not typically used in classical polarography.
explanations.c: Correct. Normal Pulse Voltammetry is a time-dependent current measurement method closely linked to polarography.
explanations.d: Linear-sweep is also a voltammetric method but less commonly used in classical polarography.

questions.question: Which of the following can be determined best using Polarographic techniques?

explanations.a: Correct. All these compounds can undergo redox reactions measurable by polarographic methods.
explanations.b: Hormones like steroids can be analyzed polarographically if electroactive.
explanations.c: Terpenoids with conjugated systems may be polarographically active.
explanations.d: Ascorbic acid (Vitamin C) is a classic compound determined using polarography.

questions.question: Which of the following is/are capable of reducing at DME?

explanations.a: Correct. Sulfhydryl (-SH) compounds can be reduced at DME.
explanations.b: Aryl methane is typically not electroactive under standard polarographic conditions.
explanations.c: Correct. Disulfides (–S–S–) are reducible at DME.
explanations.d: This is incorrect, as some listed compounds are reducible.
